entries.title: Labor board says Activision withheld raises from union activists
entries.description: The National Labor Relations Board found merit in a claim Activision Blizzard withheld raises from Raven QA testers seeking to unionize.

entries.title: Fight over social media’s role in terror content goes to Supreme Court
entries.description: A case involving Google and an ISIS attack in Paris in 2015 will give the high court a chance to review Section 230, the controversial law that shields websites from liability for users’ posts.

entries.title: U.S. crafting new rules aimed at curbing China’s advanced computing
entries.description: The United States is preparing to use a draconian export ban called the foreign direct product rule to deprive China of advanced computing chips.

entries.title: How to vet mental health advice on TikTok and Instagram
entries.description: Not all information about mental health on TikTok, Instagram and YouTube is helpful and true. Here are six questions to ask as you scroll.
